ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, definitely. It is a great summation of the current body of criticism on lyric. I understood so much more about how to confront and synthesize criticism, as well as about the lyric genre itself.

English 989 surveys theories of lyric and related theories over the course of the 20th century. The course focuses on Western, continental poetics mostly in English and French. It also tracks the development of the concept of "lyric" in its contemporary Western usage. I would recommend this course to students who are interested in studying the trends of lyric theory, or to be acquainted with contemporary debates in literary studies.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course is exactly what I needed to push forth a generalized view of the lyric genre. This was a hugely important gap in my repertoire prior to this class, and was absolutely necessary for me to pursue my dissertation interests. Thank you Lanny!
